cabra
Class ImageManager

java.lang.Object
  cabra.ImageManager

public final class ImageManager
extends java.lang.Object

Provides utility methods for using images.

Author:
Neel

createImageIcon

public static javax.swing.ImageIcon createImageIcon(java.lang.String path)
Returns an ImageIcon, or null if the path was invalid.

createImageIconFromFullPath

public static javax.swing.ImageIcon createImageIconFromFullPath(java.lang.String path)
Creates an image icon if you know its full path (C:\Users\...)

Parameters:
path - the absolute path to the image (.png, .jpg, .gif)
Returns:
the created icon

createImages

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Image> createImages(java.lang.String... paths)
Creates a list of Images (not Image Icons!) Good for use as frame icons.

Parameters:
paths - several URLs you want as possible icons, in any order.
Returns:
the created image icons converted into images.

saveImage

public static void saveImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon iconImage,
                             java.io.File saveTo)
Saves the given imageicon in the given file.

Parameters:
imageIcon - the image to save
saveTo - where to save file

copyImage

public static void copyImage(java.io.File original,
                             java.io.File copyTo)
Copies the given image file to the given location.

Parameters:
original - the file containing the image to be copied
copyTo - the file to be written to

scaleImage

public static javax.swing.ImageIcon scaleImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon image,
                                               int w,
                                               int h)
Resizes an image using a Graphics2D object backed by a BufferedImage.

Parameters:
srcImg - - source imageicon to scale
w - - desired max width
h - - desired max height
Returns:
- the new resized imageicon

showImage

public static void showImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon image,
                             javax.swing.JFrame frame)
Creates a dialog containing the image (at full size) and shows it to the user. Best used to show an image full size when the thumbnail is clicked on.

Parameters:
image - the image to show full size.
frame - the parent frame of the dialog that will be shown
